content:
As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions. However, past negotiations on the South China Sea dispute have had varying degrees of success in overcoming cultural and linguistic barriers.

For example, working with professional interpreters has been relatively successful in helping to overcome linguistic barriers. On the other hand, building personal relationships with negotiators from different cultural backgrounds has been more challenging since it can take time to establish trust and rapport.

Similarly, finding shared values has had mixed results. While all parties involved fundamentally value maintaining peace and stability in the region, disagreements over territorial claims and resource exploration have made it challenging to find mutually beneficial solutions.

Overall, the success of these strategies in past negotiations has depended on various factors, such as the personalities and negotiating styles of the participants, the geopolitical context of the dispute, and the specific issues being negotiated.
